{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents mention the importance of prompt treatment for avulsed teeth. Considering the 20-minute extraoral period and contamination with debris, it is crucial to clean the root surface before reimplantation. This approach has been discussed in 'Management of an avulsed deciduous incisor' where reattachment of periodontal fibers occurred after 2 weeks of splinting. In addition, 'Milk as storage medium for exarticulated teeth: report of case' reports a successful treatment outcome with PDL survival despite an extraoral period exceeding 12 hours.", "answer_choice": "B"}
